Note that an element that has the property IsModifier is not necessarily a "key" element (e.g. one of the important elements to make use of the resource), nor is it automatically mustSupport - however both of these things are more likely to be true for IsModifier elements than for other elements.
element.requirements: Allows a profile to set expectations for system capabilities beyond merely respecting cardinality constraints.
element.meaningWhenMissing: In a base type, where the element is being defined for the first time, the element is assumed to be mustSupport = false. In a profile (a constraint on an existing type), if mustSupport is not specific in either the differentil or the snapshot, the mustSupport value is not changed fro the base definition. Not, though, that the snapshot SHOULD always populate the mustSuppot value

element.short: If this modifies the meaning of other elements
element.definition: If true, the value of this element affects the interpretation of the element or resource that contains it, and the value of the element cannot be ignored. Typically, this is used for status, negation and qualification codes. The effect of this is that the element cannot be ignored by systems: they SHALL either recognize the element and process it, and/or a pre-determination has been made that it is not relevant to their particular system.
element.comment: Only the definition of an element can set IsModifier true - either the specification itself or where an extension is originally defined. Once set, it cannot be changed in derived profiles. An element/extension that has isModifier=true SHOULD also have a minimum cardinality of 1, so that there is no lack of clarity about what to do if it is missing. If it can be missing, the definition SHALL make the meaning of a missing element clear.
element.requirements: Allows elements to be introduced into a specification that can't safely be ignored by applications that don't recognize them.
element.meaningWhenMissing: An element is not a modifier element unless it is explicitly specified to be one

element.short: Reason that this element is marked as a modifier
element.definition: Explains how that element affects the interpretation of the resource or element that contains it.

element.short: Include when _summary = true?
element.definition: Whether the element should be included if a client requests a search with the parameter _summary=true.
element.comment: Some resources include a set of simple metadata, and some very large data. This element is used to reduce the quantity of data returned in searches. Note that servers may pre-cache summarized resources for optimal performance, so servers might not support per-profile use of the isSummary flag. When a request is made with _summary=true, serailisers only include elements marked as 'isSummary = true'. Other than Attachment.data, all data type properties are included in the summary form. In resource and data type definitions, if an element is at the root or has a parent that is 'mustSupport' and the minimum cardinality is 1 or the element is a modifier, it must be marked as isSummary=true.
element.requirements: Allow clients to search through large resources quickly.
element.meaningWhenMissing: An element is not included in the summary unless it is explicitly specified to be so

element.short: ValueSet details if this is coded
element.definition: Binds to a value set if this element is coded (code, Coding, CodeableConcept, Quantity), or the data types (string, uri).
element.comment: For a CodeableConcept, when no codes are allowed - only text, use a binding of strength "required" with a description explaining that no coded values are allowed and what sort of information to put in the "text" element.

constraint.human: ValueSet SHALL start with http:// or https:// or urn:
constraint.expression: valueSet.exists() implies (valueSet.startsWith('http:') or valueSet.startsWith('https') or valueSet.startsWith('urn:'))

element.short: required | extensible | preferred | example
element.definition: Indicates the degree of conformance expectations associated with this binding - that is, the degree to which the provided value set must be adhered to in the instances.
element.comment: For further discussion, see [Using Terminologies](terminologies.html).

extension.valueString: Indication of the degree of conformance expectations associated with a binding.

element.short: Human explanation of the value set
element.definition: Describes the intended use of this particular set of codes.

element.short: Source of value set
element.definition: Refers to the value set that identifies the set of codes the binding refers to.
element.comment: The reference may be version-specific or not (e.g. have a |[version] at the end of the canonical URL).

mapping.map: points to explicit list or expression that evaluates to list of (Enumerated_Value_Domain).member

element.short: Map element to another set of definitions
element.definition: Identifies a concept from an external specification that roughly corresponds to this element.
element.comment: Mappings are not necessarily specific enough for safe translation.
element.requirements: Provides guidance to implementers familiar with or converting content from other specifications.

mapping.map: Registered_item).document_reference[document_type=mapping]  Also, .meaning linkage to Data_Element_Concept is done as a mapping to a reference model.  (Data_Element_Concepts are all defined in some sort of reference model, be that Object_Class and Property or some other mechanism)

element.short: Reference to mapping declaration
element.definition: An internal reference to the definition of a mapping.

element.short: Computable language of mapping
element.definition: Identifies the computable language in which mapping.map is expressed.
element.comment: If omitted, then there can be no expectation of computational interpretation of the mapping.

extension.valueString: The mime type of an attachment. Any valid mime type is allowed.

element.short: Details of the mapping
element.definition: Expresses what part of the target specification corresponds to this element.
element.comment: For most mappings, the syntax is undefined.  Syntax will be provided for mappings to the RIM.  Multiple mappings may be possible and may include constraints on other resource elements that identify when a particular mapping applies.

mapping.map: ObjectClass, Property (this is one possible data model that can be mapped to - the uri would identify the data model  mappingSpecification.mappingScript

element.short: Comments about the mapping or its use
element.definition: Comments that provide information about the mapping or its use.

resource.name: Expression
resource.description: Base StructureDefinition for Expression Type: A expression that is evaluated in a specified context and returns a value. The context of use of the expression must specify the context in which the expression is evaluated, and how the result of the expression is used.

element.short: An expression that can be used to generate a value
element.definition: A expression that is evaluated in a specified context and returns a value. The context of use of the expression must specify the context in which the expression is evaluated, and how the result of the expression is used.

constraint.human: An expression or a reference must be provided

element.short: Natural language description of the condition
element.definition: A brief, natural language description of the condition that effectively communicates the intended semantics.

element.short: Short name assigned to expression for reuse
element.definition: A short name assigned to the expression to allow for multiple reuse of the expression in the context where it is defined.

element.short: text/cql | text/fhirpath | application/x-fhir-query | etc.
element.definition: The media type of the language for the expression.

extension.valueString: The media type of the expression language.

element.short: Expression in specified language
element.definition: An expression in the specified language that returns a value.

element.short: Where the expression is found
element.definition: A URI that defines where the expression is found.
element.comment: If both a reference and an expression is found, the reference SHALL point to the same expression.

resource.name: Extension
resource.description: Base StructureDefinition for Extension Type: Optional Extension Element - found in all resources.
resource.purpose: The ability to add extensions in a structured way is what keeps FHIR resources simple.

element.short: Optional Extensions Element
element.definition: Optional Extension Element - found in all resources.

constraint.human: Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.short: identifies the meaning of the extension
element.definition: Source of the definition for the extension code - a logical name or a URL.
element.comment: The definition may point directly to a computable or human-readable definition of the extensibility codes, or it may be a logical URI as declared in some other specification. The definition SHALL be a URI for the Structure Definition defining the extension.

element.short: Value of extension
element.definition: Value of extension - must be one of a constrained set of the data types (see [Extensibility](extensibility.html) for a list).

resource.name: HumanName
resource.description: Base StructureDefinition for HumanName Type: A human's name with the ability to identify parts and usage.
resource.purpose: Need to be able to record names, along with notes about their use.

element.short: Name of a human - parts and usage
element.definition: A human's name with the ability to identify parts and usage.
element.comment: Names may be changed, or repudiated, or people may have different names in different contexts. Names may be divided into parts of different type that have variable significance depending on context, though the division into parts does not always matter. With personal names, the different parts might or might not be imbued with some implicit meaning; various cultures associate different importance with the name parts and the degree to which systems must care about name parts around the world varies widely.

element.short: usual | official | temp | nickname | anonymous | old | maiden
element.definition: Identifies the purpose for this name.
element.comment: Applications can assume that a name is current unless it explicitly says that it is temporary or old.
element.requirements: Allows the appropriate name for a particular context of use to be selected from among a set of names.
element.isModifierReason: This is labeled as "Is Modifier" because applications should not mistake a temporary or old name etc.for a current/permanent one

extension.valueString: The use of a human name.

mapping.map: XPN.7, but often indicated by which field contains the name

element.short: Text representation of the full name
element.definition: Specifies the entire name as it should be displayed e.g. on an application UI. This may be provided instead of or as well as the specific parts.
element.comment: Can provide both a text representation and parts. Applications updating a name SHALL ensure that when both text and parts are present,  no content is included in the text that isn't found in a part.
element.requirements: A renderable, unencoded form.

element.short: Family name (often called 'Surname')
element.definition: The part of a name that links to the genealogy. In some cultures (e.g. Eritrea) the family name of a son is the first name of his father.
element.comment: Family Name may be decomposed into specific parts using extensions (de, nl, es related cultures).

element.short: Given names (not always 'first'). Includes middle names
element.definition: Given name.
element.comment: If only initials are recorded, they may be used in place of the full name parts. Initials may be separated into multiple given names but often aren't due to paractical limitations.  This element is not called "first name" since given names do not always come first.
element.orderMeaning: Given Names appear in the correct order for presenting the name

element.short: Parts that come before the name
element.definition: Part of the name that is acquired as a title due to academic, legal, employment or nobility status, etc. and that appears at the start of the name.
element.orderMeaning: Prefixes appear in the correct order for presenting the name

element.short: Parts that come after the name
element.definition: Part of the name that is acquired as a title due to academic, legal, employment or nobility status, etc. and that appears at the end of the name.
element.orderMeaning: Suffixes appear in the correct order for presenting the name

element.short: Time period when name was/is in use
element.definition: Indicates the period of time when this name was valid for the named person.
element.requirements: Allows names to be placed in historical context.

resource.name: Identifier
resource.description: Base StructureDefinition for Identifier Type: An identifier - identifies some entity uniquely and unambiguously. Typically this is used for business identifiers.
resource.purpose: Need to be able to identify things with confidence and be sure that the identification is not subject to misinterpretation.

element.short: An identifier intended for computation
element.definition: An identifier - identifies some entity uniquely and unambiguously. Typically this is used for business identifiers.

mapping.map: CX / EI (occasionally, more often EI maps to a resource id or a URL)
II - The Identifier class is a little looser than the v3 type II because it allows URIs as well as registered OIDs or GUIDs.  Also maps to Role[classCode=IDENT]

element.short: usual | official | temp | secondary | old (If known)
element.definition: The purpose of this identifier.
element.comment: Applications can assume that an identifier is permanent unless it explicitly says that it is temporary.
element.requirements: Allows the appropriate identifier for a particular context of use to be selected from among a set of identifiers.
element.isModifierReason: This is labeled as "Is Modifier" because applications should not mistake a temporary id for a permanent one.

extension.valueString: Identifies the purpose for this identifier, if known .

element.short: Description of identifier
element.definition: A coded type for the identifier that can be used to determine which identifier to use for a specific purpose.
element.comment: This element deals only with general categories of identifiers.  It SHOULD not be used for codes that correspond 1..1 with the Identifier.system. Some identifiers may fall into multiple categories due to common usage.   Where the system is known, a type is unnecessary because the type is always part of the system definition. However systems often need to handle identifiers where the system is not known. There is not a 1:1 relationship between type and system, since many different systems have the same type.
element.requirements: Allows users to make use of identifiers when the identifier system is not known.

extension.valueString: A coded type for an identifier that can be used to determine which identifier to use for a specific purpose.

element.short: The namespace for the identifier value
element.definition: Establishes the namespace for the value - that is, a URL that describes a set values that are unique.
element.comment: Identifier.system is always case sensitive.
element.requirements: There are many sets  of identifiers.  To perform matching of two identifiers, we need to know what set we're dealing with. The system identifies a particular set of unique identifiers.

element.short: The value that is unique
element.definition: The portion of the identifier typically relevant to the user and which is unique within the context of the system.
element.comment: If the value is a full URI, then the system SHALL be urn:ietf:rfc:3986.  The value's primary purpose is computational mapping.  As a result, it may be normalized for comparison purposes (e.g. removing non-significant whitespace, dashes, etc.)  A value formatted for human display can be conveyed using the [Rendered Value extension](extension-rendered-value.html). Identifier.value is to be treated as case sensitive unless knowledge of the Identifier.system allows the processer to be confident that non-case-sensitive processing is safe.

mapping.map: II.extension or II.root if system indicates OID or GUID (Or Role.id.extension or root)

element.short: Time period when id is/was valid for use
element.definition: Time period during which identifier is/was valid for use.

element.short: Organization that issued id (may be just text)
element.definition: Organization that issued/manages the identifier.
element.comment: The Identifier.assigner may omit the .reference element and only contain a .display element reflecting the name or other textual information about the assigning organization.

mapping.map: II.assigningAuthorityName but note that this is an improper use by the definition of the field.  Also Role.scoper

resource.name: MarketingStatus
resource.description: Base StructureDefinition for MarketingStatus Type: The marketing status describes the date when a medicinal product is actually put on the market or the date as of which it is no longer available.

element.short: The marketing status describes the date when a medicinal product is actually put on the market or the date as of which it is no longer available
element.definition: The marketing status describes the date when a medicinal product is actually put on the market or the date as of which it is no longer available.

element.short: The country in which the marketing authorisation has been granted shall be specified It should be specified using the ISO 3166 â€‘ 1 alpha-2 code elements
element.definition: The country in which the marketing authorisation has been granted shall be specified It should be specified using the ISO 3166 â€‘ 1 alpha-2 code elements.

element.short: Where a Medicines Regulatory Agency has granted a marketing authorisation for which specific provisions within a jurisdiction apply, the jurisdiction can be specified using an appropriate controlled terminology The controlled term and the controlled term identifier shall be specified
element.definition: Where a Medicines Regulatory Agency has granted a marketing authorisation for which specific provisions within a jurisdiction apply, the jurisdiction can be specified using an appropriate controlled terminology The controlled term and the controlled term identifier shall be specified.

element.short: This attribute provides information on the status of the marketing of the medicinal product See ISO/TS 20443 for more information and examples
element.definition: This attribute provides information on the status of the marketing of the medicinal product See ISO/TS 20443 for more information and examples.

element.short: The date when the Medicinal Product is placed on the market by the Marketing Authorisation Holder (or where applicable, the manufacturer/distributor) in a country and/or jurisdiction shall be provided A complete date consisting of day, month and year shall be specified using the ISO 8601 date format NOTE â€œPlaced on the marketâ€ refers to the release of the Medicinal Product into the distribution chain
element.definition: The date when the Medicinal Product is placed on the market by the Marketing Authorisation Holder (or where applicable, the manufacturer/distributor) in a country and/or jurisdiction shall be provided A complete date consisting of day, month and year shall be specified using the ISO 8601 date format NOTE â€œPlaced on the marketâ€ refers to the release of the Medicinal Product into the distribution chain.

element.short: The date when the Medicinal Product is placed on the market by the Marketing Authorisation Holder (or where applicable, the manufacturer/distributor) in a country and/or jurisdiction shall be provided A complete date consisting of day, month and year shall be specified using the ISO 8601 date format NOTE â€œPlaced on the marketâ€ refers to the release of the Medicinal Product into the distribution chain
element.definition: The date when the Medicinal Product is placed on the market by the Marketing Authorisation Holder (or where applicable, the manufacturer/distributor) in a country and/or jurisdiction shall be provided A complete date consisting of day, month and year shall be specified using the ISO 8601 date format NOTE â€œPlaced on the marketâ€ refers to the release of the Medicinal Product into the distribution chain.

resource.name: Meta
resource.description: Base StructureDefinition for Meta Type: The metadata about a resource. This is content in the resource that is maintained by the infrastructure. Changes to the content might not always be associated with version changes to the resource.

element.short: Metadata about a resource
element.definition: The metadata about a resource. This is content in the resource that is maintained by the infrastructure. Changes to the content might not always be associated with version changes to the resource.

element.short: Version specific identifier
element.definition: The version specific identifier, as it appears in the version portion of the URL. This value changes when the resource is created, updated, or deleted.
element.comment: The server assigns this value, and ignores what the client specifies, except in the case that the server is imposing version integrity on updates/deletes.

element.short: When the resource version last changed
element.definition: When the resource last changed - e.g. when the version changed.
element.comment: This value is always populated except when the resource is first being created. The server / resource manager sets this value; what a client provides is irrelevant. This is equivalent to the HTTP Last-Modified and SHOULD have the same value on a [read](http.html#read) interaction.

element.short: Identifies where the resource comes from
element.definition: A uri that identifies the source system of the resource. This provides a minimal amount of [Provenance](provenance.html#) information that can be used to track or differentiate the source of information in the resource. The source may identify another FHIR server, document, message, database, etc.
element.comment:
In the provenance resource, this corresponds to Provenance.entity.what[x]. The exact use of the source (and the implied Provenance.entity.role) is left to implementer discretion. Only one nominated source is allowed; for additional provenance details, a full Provenance resource should be used. 

This element can be used to indicate where the current master source of a resource that has a canonical URL if the resource is no longer hosted at the canonical URL.

element.short: Profiles this resource claims to conform to
element.definition: A list of profiles (references to [StructureDefinition](structuredefinition.html#) resources) that this resource claims to conform to. The URL is a reference to [StructureDefinition.url](structuredefinition-definitions.html#StructureDefinition.url).
element.comment: It is up to the server and/or other infrastructure of policy to determine whether/how these claims are verified and/or updated over time.  The list of profile URLs is a set.

element.short: Security Labels applied to this resource
element.definition: Security labels applied to this resource. These tags connect specific resources to the overall security policy and infrastructure.
element.comment: The security labels can be updated without changing the stated version of the resource. The list of security labels is a set. Uniqueness is based the system/code, and version and display are ignored.

extension.valueString: Security Labels from the Healthcare Privacy and Security Classification System.

element.short: Tags applied to this resource
element.definition: Tags applied to this resource. Tags are intended to be used to identify and relate resources to process and workflow, and applications are not required to consider the tags when interpreting the meaning of a resource.
element.comment: The tags can be updated without changing the stated version of the resource. The list of tags is a set. Uniqueness is based the system/code, and version and display are ignored.

extension.valueString: Codes that represent various types of tags, commonly workflow-related; e.g. "Needs review by Dr. Jones".

resource.name: Money
resource.description: Base StructureDefinition for Money Type: An amount of economic utility in some recognized currency.

element.short: An amount of economic utility in some recognized currency
element.definition: An amount of economic utility in some recognized currency.

element.short: Numerical value (with implicit precision)
element.definition: Numerical value (with implicit precision).
element.comment: Monetary values have their own rules for handling precision (refer to standard accounting text books).
element.requirements: The amount of the currency. The value includes an implicit precision in the presentation of the value.

element.short: ISO 4217 Currency Code
element.definition: ISO 4217 Currency Code.
element.requirements: A code indicating the currency, taken from ISO 4217.

extension.valueString: A code indicating the currency, taken from ISO 4217.

resource.name: Narrative
resource.description: Base StructureDefinition for Narrative Type: A human-readable summary of the resource conveying the essential clinical and business information for the resource.

element.short: Human-readable summary of the resource (essential clinical and business information)
element.definition: A human-readable summary of the resource conveying the essential clinical and business information for the resource.

element.short: generated | extensions | additional | empty
element.definition: The status of the narrative - whether it's entirely generated (from just the defined data or the extensions too), or whether a human authored it and it may contain additional data.

extension.valueString: The status of a resource narrative.

element.short: Limited xhtml content
element.definition: The actual narrative content, a stripped down version of XHTML.
element.comment: The contents of the html element are an XHTML fragment containing only the basic html formatting elements described in chapters 7-11 and 15 of the HTML 4.0 standard, <a> elements (either name or href), images and internally contained stylesheets. The XHTML content SHALL NOT contain a head, a body, external stylesheet references, scripts, forms, base/link/xlink, frames, iframes and objects.

constraint.human: The narrative SHALL contain only the basic html formatting elements and attributes described in chapters 7-11 (except section 4 of chapter 9) and 15 of the HTML 4.0 standard, <a> elements (either name or href), images and internally contained style attributes
The narrative SHALL have some non-whitespace content

resource.name: OrderedDistribution
resource.description: Base StructureDefinition for OrderedDistribution Type: An ordered list (distribution) of statistics.

element.short: An ordered list (distribution) of statistics
element.definition: An ordered list (distribution) of statistics.

constraint.human: The cardinality of interval SHALL equal the value of numberOfIntervals

element.short: A description of the content and value of the statistic
element.definition: A description of the content and value of the statistic.

element.short: Footnotes and/or explanatory notes
element.definition: Footnotes and/or explanatory notes.

element.short: Number of intervals in an array, eg 4 for quartiles
element.definition: Number of intervals in an array, eg 4 for quartiles.

element.short: Bottom of first interval
element.definition: Bottom of first interval.

constraint.human: If minimum is not empty, all instances of interval.maximum  must either be absent or > minimum..

element.short: Interval
element.definition: Interval.

constraint.human: For every interval n, if n.maximum is not empty then, for every interval k, if k.rankOrder < n.rankOrder then k.maximum must be < n.maximum or empty.

element.short: Relative order of interval
element.definition: Relative order of interval.

constraint.human: The rankOrder value SHALL be an integer from 1 to k where k is the value of numberOfIntervals
Now two intervals in the same OrderedDistribution can have the same rankOrder

element.short: Values and parameters for a single statistic related to the interval
element.definition: Values and parameters for a single statistic related to the interval.

element.short: Singular value of the statistic at the upper bound of the interval
element.definition: Singular value of the statistic at the upper bound of the interval.

resource.name: ParameterDefinition
resource.description: Base StructureDefinition for ParameterDefinition Type: The parameters to the module. This collection specifies both the input and output parameters. Input parameters are provided by the caller as part of the $evaluate operation. Output parameters are included in the GuidanceResponse.

element.short: Definition of a parameter to a module
element.definition: The parameters to the module. This collection specifies both the input and output parameters. Input parameters are provided by the caller as part of the $evaluate operation. Output parameters are included in the GuidanceResponse.

element.short: Name used to access the parameter value
element.definition: The name of the parameter used to allow access to the value of the parameter in evaluation contexts.

element.short: in | out
element.definition: Whether the parameter is input or output for the module.

extension.valueString: Whether the parameter is input or output.

element.short: Minimum cardinality
element.definition: The minimum number of times this parameter SHALL appear in the request or response.

element.short: Maximum cardinality (a number of *)
element.definition: The maximum number of times this element is permitted to appear in the request or response.

element.short: A brief description of the parameter
element.definition: A brief discussion of what the parameter is for and how it is used by the module.

element.short: What type of value
element.definition: The type of the parameter.

extension.valueString: A list of all the concrete types defined in this version of the FHIR specification - Abstract Types, Data Types and Resource Types.

element.short: What profile the value is expected to be
element.definition: If specified, this indicates a profile that the input data must conform to, or that the output data will conform to.

resource.name: Period
resource.description: Base StructureDefinition for Period Type: A time period defined by a start and end date and optionally time.

element.short: Time range defined by start and end date/time
element.definition: A time period defined by a start and end date and optionally time.
element.comment:
A Period specifies a range of time; the context of use will specify whether the entire range applies (e.g. "the patient was an inpatient of the hospital for this time range") or one value from the range applies (e.g. "give to the patient between these two times").

Period is not used for a duration (a measure of elapsed time). See [Duration](datatypes.html#Duration).

constraint.human: If present, start SHALL have a lower value than end

mapping.map: IVL<TS>[lowClosed="true" and highClosed="true"] or URG<TS>[lowClosed="true" and highClosed="true"]

element.short: Starting time with inclusive boundary
element.definition: The start of the period. The boundary is inclusive.
element.comment: If the low element is missing, the meaning is that the low boundary is not known.

element.short: End time with inclusive boundary, if not ongoing
element.definition: The end of the period. If the end of the period is missing, it means no end was known or planned at the time the instance was created. The start may be in the past, and the end date in the future, which means that period is expected/planned to end at that time.
element.comment: The high value includes any matching date/time. i.e. 2012-02-03T10:00:00 is in a period that has an end value of 2012-02-03.
element.meaningWhenMissing: If the end of the period is missing, it means that the period is ongoing

resource.name: Population
resource.description: Base StructureDefinition for Population Type: A populatioof people with some set of grouping criteria.

element.short: A definition of a set of people that apply to some clinically related context, for example people contraindicated for a certain medication
element.definition: A populatioof people with some set of grouping criteria.

element.short: The age of the specific population
element.definition: The age of the specific population.

element.short: The gender of the specific population
element.definition: The gender of the specific population.

element.short: Race of the specific population
element.definition: Race of the specific population.

element.short: The existing physiological conditions of the specific population to which this applies
element.definition: The existing physiological conditions of the specific population to which this applies.

resource.name: PrimitiveType
resource.description: Base StructureDefinition for PrimitiveType Type: The base type for all re-useable types defined that have a simple property.

element.short: Parent type for DataTypes with a simple value
element.definition: The base type for all re-useable types defined that have a simple property.

resource.name: ProdCharacteristic
resource.description: Base StructureDefinition for ProdCharacteristic Type: The marketing status describes the date when a medicinal product is actually put on the market or the date as of which it is no longer available.

element.short: The marketing status describes the date when a medicinal product is actually put on the market or the date as of which it is no longer available
element.definition: The marketing status describes the date when a medicinal product is actually put on the market or the date as of which it is no longer available.

element.short: Where applicable, the height can be specified using a numerical value and its unit of measurement The unit of measurement shall be specified in accordance with ISO 11240 and the resulting terminology The symbol and the symbol identifier shall be used
element.definition: Where applicable, the height can be specified using a numerical value and its unit of measurement The unit of measurement shall be specified in accordance with ISO 11240 and the resulting terminology The symbol and the symbol identifier shall be used.

element.short: Where applicable, the width can be specified using a numerical value and its unit of measurement The unit of measurement shall be specified in accordance with ISO 11240 and the resulting terminology The symbol and the symbol identifier shall be used
element.definition: Where applicable, the width can be specified using a numerical value and its unit of measurement The unit of measurement shall be specified in accordance with ISO 11240 and the resulting terminology The symbol and the symbol identifier shall be used.

element.short: Where applicable, the depth can be specified using a numerical value and its unit of measurement The unit of measurement shall be specified in accordance with ISO 11240 and the resulting terminology The symbol and the symbol identifier shall be used
element.definition: Where applicable, the depth can be specified using a numerical value and its unit of measurement The unit of measurement shall be specified in accordance with ISO 11240 and the resulting terminology The symbol and the symbol identifier shall be used.

element.short: Where applicable, the weight can be specified using a numerical value and its unit of measurement The unit of measurement shall be specified in accordance with ISO 11240 and the resulting terminology The symbol and the symbol identifier shall be used
element.definition: Where applicable, the weight can be specified using a numerical value and its unit of measurement The unit of measurement shall be specified in accordance with ISO 11240 and the resulting terminology The symbol and the symbol identifier shall be used.

element.short: Where applicable, the nominal volume can be specified using a numerical value and its unit of measurement The unit of measurement shall be specified in accordance with ISO 11240 and the resulting terminology The symbol and the symbol identifier shall be used
element.definition: Where applicable, the nominal volume can be specified using a numerical value and its unit of measurement The unit of measurement shall be specified in accordance with ISO 11240 and the resulting terminology The symbol and the symbol identifier shall be used.

element.short: Where applicable, the external diameter can be specified using a numerical value and its unit of measurement The unit of measurement shall be specified in accordance with ISO 11240 and the resulting terminology The symbol and the symbol identifier shall be used
element.definition: Where applicable, the external diameter can be specified using a numerical value and its unit of measurement The unit of measurement shall be specified in accordance with ISO 11240 and the resulting terminology The symbol and the symbol identifier shall be used.

element.short: Where applicable, the shape can be specified An appropriate controlled vocabulary shall be used The term and the term identifier shall be used
element.definition: Where applicable, the shape can be specified An appropriate controlled vocabulary shall be used The term and the term identifier shall be used.

element.short: Where applicable, the color can be specified An appropriate controlled vocabulary shall be used The term and the term identifier shall be used
element.definition: Where applicable, the color can be specified An appropriate controlled vocabulary shall be used The term and the term identifier shall be used.

element.short: Where applicable, the imprint can be specified as text
element.definition: Where applicable, the imprint can be specified as text.

element.short: Where applicable, the image can be provided The format of the image attachment shall be specified by regional implementations
element.definition: Where applicable, the image can be provided The format of the image attachment shall be specified by regional implementations.

element.short: Where applicable, the scoring can be specified An appropriate controlled vocabulary shall be used The term and the term identifier shall be used
element.definition: Where applicable, the scoring can be specified An appropriate controlled vocabulary shall be used The term and the term identifier shall be used.

resource.name: ProductShelfLife
resource.description: Base StructureDefinition for ProductShelfLife Type: The shelf-life and storage information for a medicinal product item or container can be described using this class.

element.short: The shelf-life and storage information for a medicinal product item or container can be described using this class
element.definition: The shelf-life and storage information for a medicinal product item or container can be described using this class.

element.short: This describes the shelf life, taking into account various scenarios such as shelf life of the packaged Medicinal Product itself, shelf life after transformation where necessary and shelf life after the first opening of a bottle, etc. The shelf life type shall be specified using an appropriate controlled vocabulary The controlled term and the controlled term identifier shall be specified
element.definition: This describes the shelf life, taking into account various scenarios such as shelf life of the packaged Medicinal Product itself, shelf life after transformation where necessary and shelf life after the first opening of a bottle, etc. The shelf life type shall be specified using an appropriate controlled vocabulary The controlled term and the controlled term identifier shall be specified.

element.short: The shelf life time period can be specified using a numerical value for the period of time and its unit of time measurement The unit of measurement shall be specified in accordance with ISO 11240 and the resulting terminology The symbol and the symbol identifier shall be used
element.definition: The shelf life time period can be specified using a numerical value for the period of time and its unit of time measurement The unit of measurement shall be specified in accordance with ISO 11240 and the resulting terminology The symbol and the symbol identifier shall be used.

element.short: Special precautions for storage, if any, can be specified using an appropriate controlled vocabulary The controlled term and the controlled term identifier shall be specified
element.definition: Special precautions for storage, if any, can be specified using an appropriate controlled vocabulary The controlled term and the controlled term identifier shall be specified.

resource.name: Quantity
resource.description: Base StructureDefinition for Quantity Type: A measured amount (or an amount that can potentially be measured). Note that measured amounts include amounts that are not precisely quantified, including amounts involving arbitrary units and floating currencies.
resource.purpose: Need to able to capture all sorts of measured values, even if the measured value are not precisely quantified. Values include exact measures such as 3.51g, customary units such as 3 tablets, and currencies such as $100.32USD.

element.short: A measured or measurable amount
element.definition: A measured amount (or an amount that can potentially be measured). Note that measured amounts include amounts that are not precisely quantified, including amounts involving arbitrary units and floating currencies.
element.comment: The context of use may frequently define what kind of quantity this is and therefore what kind of units can be used. The context of use may also restrict the values for the comparator.

constraint.human: If a code for the unit is present, the system SHALL also be present

mapping.map: PQ, IVL<PQ>, MO, CO, depending on the values

element.short: Numerical value (with implicit precision)
element.definition: The value of the measured amount. The value includes an implicit precision in the presentation of the value.
element.comment: The implicit precision in the value should always be honored. Monetary values have their own rules for handling precision (refer to standard accounting text books).
element.requirements: Precision is handled implicitly in almost all cases of measurement.

mapping.map: PQ.value, CO.value, MO.value, IVL.high or IVL.low depending on the value

element.short: < | <= | >= | > - how to understand the value
element.definition: How the value should be understood and represented - whether the actual value is greater or less than the stated value due to measurement issues; e.g. if the comparator is "<" , then the real value is < stated value.
element.requirements: Need a framework for handling measures where the value is <5ug/L or >400mg/L due to the limitations of measuring methodology.
element.meaningWhenMissing: If there is no comparator, then there is no modification of the value
element.isModifierReason: This is labeled as "Is Modifier" because the comparator modifies the interpretation of the value significantly. If there is no comparator, then there is no modification of the value

extension.valueString: How the Quantity should be understood and represented.

element.short: Unit representation
element.definition: A human-readable form of the unit.
element.requirements: There are many representations for units of measure and in many contexts, particular representations are fixed and required. I.e. mcg for micrograms.

element.short: System that defines coded unit form
element.definition: The identification of the system that provides the coded form of the unit.
element.requirements: Need to know the system that defines the coded form of the unit.

element.short: Coded form of the unit
element.definition: A computer processable form of the unit in some unit representation system.
element.comment: The preferred system is UCUM, but SNOMED CT can also be used (for customary units) or ISO 4217 for currency.  The context of use may additionally require a code from a particular system.
element.requirements: Need a computable form of the unit that is fixed across all forms. UCUM provides this for quantities, but SNOMED CT provides many units of interest.

resource.name: Range
resource.description: Base StructureDefinition for Range Type: A set of ordered Quantities defined by a low and high limit.
resource.purpose: Need to be able to specify ranges of values.

element.short: Set of values bounded by low and high
element.definition: A set of ordered Quantities defined by a low and high limit.
element.comment: The stated low and high value are assumed to have arbitrarily high precision when it comes to determining which values are in the range. I.e. 1.99 is not in the range 2 -> 3.

constraint.human: If present, low SHALL have a lower value than high

mapping.map: NR and also possibly SN (but see also quantity)

element.short: Low limit
element.definition: The low limit. The boundary is inclusive.
element.comment: If the low element is missing, the low boundary is not known.

element.short: High limit
element.definition: The high limit. The boundary is inclusive.
element.comment: If the high element is missing, the high boundary is not known.

resource.name: Ratio
resource.description: Base StructureDefinition for Ratio Type: A relationship of two Quantity values - expressed as a numerator and a denominator.
resource.purpose: Need to able to capture ratios for some measurements (titers) and some rates (costs).

element.short: A ratio of two Quantity values - a numerator and a denominator
element.definition: A relationship of two Quantity values - expressed as a numerator and a denominator.
element.comment: The Ratio datatype should only be used to express a relationship of two numbers if the relationship cannot be suitably expressed using a Quantity and a common unit.  Where the denominator value is known to be fixed to "1", Quantity should be used instead of Ratio.

constraint.human: Numerator and denominator SHALL both be present, or both are absent. If both are absent, there SHALL be some extension present

element.short: Numerator value
element.definition: The value of the numerator.

element.short: Denominator value
element.definition: The value of the denominator.

resource.name: Reference
resource.description: Base StructureDefinition for Reference Type: A reference from one resource to another.

element.short: A reference from one resource to another
element.definition: A reference from one resource to another.
element.comment: References SHALL be a reference to an actual FHIR resource, and SHALL be resolveable (allowing for access control, temporary unavailability, etc.). Resolution can be either by retrieval from the URL, or, where applicable by resource type, by treating an absolute reference as a canonical URL and looking it up in a local registry/repository.

constraint.human: SHALL have a contained resource if a local reference is provided

mapping.map: The target of a resource reference is a RIM entry point (Act, Role, or Entity)

element.short: Literal reference, Relative, internal or absolute URL
element.definition: A reference to a location at which the other resource is found. The reference may be a relative reference, in which case it is relative to the service base URL, or an absolute URL that resolves to the location where the resource is found. The reference may be version specific or not. If the reference is not to a FHIR RESTful server, then it should be assumed to be version specific. Internal fragment references (start with '#') refer to contained resources.
element.comment: Using absolute URLs provides a stable scalable approach suitable for a cloud/web context, while using relative/logical references provides a flexible approach suitable for use when trading across closed eco-system boundaries.   Absolute URLs do not need to point to a FHIR RESTful server, though this is the preferred approach. If the URL conforms to the structure "/[type]/[id]" then it should be assumed that the reference is to a FHIR RESTful server.

element.short: Type the reference refers to (e.g. "Patient")
element.definition:
The expected type of the target of the reference. If both Reference.type and Reference.reference are populated and Reference.reference is a FHIR URL, both SHALL be consistent.

The type is the Canonical URL of Resource Definition that is the type this reference refers to. References are URLs that are relative to http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/ e.g. "Patient" is a reference to http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/Patient. Absolute URLs are only allowed for logical models (and can only be used in references in logical models, not resources).
element.comment: This element is used to indicate the type of  the target of the reference. This may be used which ever of the other elements are populated (or not). In some cases, the type of the target may be determined by inspection of the reference (e.g. a RESTful URL) or by resolving the target of the reference; if both the type and a reference is provided, the reference SHALL resolve to a resource of the same type as that specified.

extension.valueString: Aa resource (or, for logical models, the URI of the logical model).

element.short: Logical reference, when literal reference is not known
element.definition: An identifier for the target resource. This is used when there is no way to reference the other resource directly, either because the entity it represents is not available through a FHIR server, or because there is no way for the author of the resource to convert a known identifier to an actual location. There is no requirement that a Reference.identifier point to something that is actually exposed as a FHIR instance, but it SHALL point to a business concept that would be expected to be exposed as a FHIR instance, and that instance would need to be of a FHIR resource type allowed by the reference.
element.comment:
When an identifier is provided in place of a reference, any system processing the reference will only be able to resolve the identifier to a reference if it understands the business context in which the identifier is used. Sometimes this is global (e.g. a national identifier) but often it is not. For this reason, none of the useful mechanisms described for working with references (e.g. chaining, includes) are possible, nor should servers be expected to be able resolve the reference. Servers may accept an identifier based reference untouched, resolve it, and/or reject it - see CapabilityStatement.rest.resource.referencePolicy. 

When both an identifier and a literal reference are provided, the literal reference is preferred. Applications processing the resource are allowed - but not required - to check that the identifier matches the literal reference

Applications converting a logical reference to a literal reference may choose to leave the logical reference present, or remove it.

Reference is intended to point to a structure that can potentially be expressed as a FHIR resource, though there is no need for it to exist as an actual FHIR resource instance - except in as much as an application wishes to actual find the target of the reference. The content referred to be the identifier must meet the logical constraints implied by any limitations on what resource types are permitted for the reference.  For example, it would not be legitimate to send the identifier for a drug prescription if the type were Reference(Observation|DiagnosticReport).  One of the use-cases for Reference.identifier is the situation where no FHIR representation exists (where the type is Reference (Any).

element.short: Text alternative for the resource
element.definition: Plain text narrative that identifies the resource in addition to the resource reference.
element.comment: This is generally not the same as the Resource.text of the referenced resource.  The purpose is to identify what's being referenced, not to fully describe it.

resource.name: RelatedArtifact
resource.description: Base StructureDefinition for RelatedArtifact Type: Related artifacts such as additional documentation, justification, or bibliographic references.
resource.purpose: Knowledge resources must be able to provide enough information for consumers of the content (and/or interventions or results produced by the content) to be able to determine and understand the justification for and evidence in support of the content.

element.short: Related artifacts for a knowledge resource
element.definition: Related artifacts such as additional documentation, justification, or bibliographic references.
element.comment: Each related artifact is either an attachment, or a reference to another knowledge resource, but not both.

element.short: documentation | justification | citation | predecessor | successor | derived-from | depends-on | composed-of
element.definition: The type of relationship to the related artifact.

extension.valueString: The type of relationship to the related artifact.

element.short: Short label
element.definition: A short label that can be used to reference the citation from elsewhere in the containing artifact, such as a footnote index.

element.short: Brief description of the related artifact
element.definition: A brief description of the document or knowledge resource being referenced, suitable for display to a consumer.

element.short: Bibliographic citation for the artifact
element.definition: A bibliographic citation for the related artifact. This text SHOULD be formatted according to an accepted citation format.
element.comment: Additional structured information about citations should be captured as extensions.

element.short: Where the artifact can be accessed
element.definition: A url for the artifact that can be followed to access the actual content.
element.comment: If a document or resource element is present, this element SHALL NOT be provided (use the url or reference in the Attachment or resource reference).

element.short: What document is being referenced
element.definition: The document being referenced, represented as an attachment. This is exclusive with the resource element.

element.short: What resource is being referenced
element.definition: The related resource, such as a library, value set, profile, or other knowledge resource.
element.comment: If the type is predecessor, this is a reference to the succeeding knowledge resource. If the type is successor, this is a reference to the prior knowledge resource.

resource.name: SampledData
resource.description: Base StructureDefinition for SampledData Type: A series of measurements taken by a device, with upper and lower limits. There may be more than one dimension in the data.
resource.purpose: There is a need for a concise way to handle the data produced by devices that sample a physical state at a high frequency.

element.short: A series of measurements taken by a device
element.definition: A series of measurements taken by a device, with upper and lower limits. There may be more than one dimension in the data.
element.comment: The data is not interpretable without at least origin, period, and dimensions, but these are optional to allow a separation between the template of measurement and the actual measurement, such as between DeviceCapabilities and DeviceLog.  When providing a summary view (for example with Observation.value[x]) SampledData should be represented with a brief display text such as "Sampled Data".

element.short: Zero value and units
element.definition: The base quantity that a measured value of zero represents. In addition, this provides the units of the entire measurement series.

element.short: Number of milliseconds between samples
element.definition: The length of time between sampling times, measured in milliseconds.
element.comment: This is usually a whole number.

element.short: Multiply data by this before adding to origin
element.definition: A correction factor that is applied to the sampled data points before they are added to the origin.
element.meaningWhenMissing: If no factor is assigned, the data is not adjusted before adding to the origin

element.short: Lower limit of detection
element.definition: The lower limit of detection of the measured points. This is needed if any of the data points have the value "L" (lower than detection limit).

element.short: Upper limit of detection
element.definition: The upper limit of detection of the measured points. This is needed if any of the data points have the value "U" (higher than detection limit).

element.short: Number of sample points at each time point
element.definition: The number of sample points at each time point. If this value is greater than one, then the dimensions will be interlaced - all the sample points for a point in time will be recorded at once.
element.comment: If there is more than one dimension, the code for the type of data will define the meaning of the dimensions (typically ECG data).

element.short: Decimal values with spaces, or "E" | "U" | "L"
element.definition: A series of data points which are decimal values separated by a single space (character u20). The special values "E" (error), "L" (below detection limit) and "U" (above detection limit) can also be used in place of a decimal value.
element.comment: Data may be missing if it is omitted for summarization purposes. In general, data is required for any actual use of a SampledData.

resource.name: Signature
resource.description: Base StructureDefinition for Signature Type: A signature along with supporting context. The signature may be a digital signature that is cryptographic in nature, or some other signature acceptable to the domain. This other signature may be as simple as a graphical image representing a hand-written signature, or a signature ceremony Different signature approaches have different utilities.
resource.purpose: There are a number of places where content must be signed in healthcare.

element.short: A Signature - XML DigSig, JWS, Graphical image of signature, etc.
element.definition: A signature along with supporting context. The signature may be a digital signature that is cryptographic in nature, or some other signature acceptable to the domain. This other signature may be as simple as a graphical image representing a hand-written signature, or a signature ceremony Different signature approaches have different utilities.
element.comment: The elements of the Signature Resource are for ease of access of these elements. For digital signatures (Xml DigSig, JWS), the non-repudiation proof comes from the Signature  validation, which includes validation of the referenced objects (e.g. Resources) (a.k.a., Content) in the XML-Signature Detached form.

element.short: Indication of the reason the entity signed the object(s)
element.definition: An indication of the reason that the entity signed this document. This may be explicitly included as part of the signature information and can be used when determining accountability for various actions concerning the document.
element.comment: Examples include attesting to: authorship, correct transcription, and witness of specific event. Also known as a "Commitment Type Indication".

extension.valueString: An indication of the reason that an entity signed the object.

element.short: When the signature was created
element.definition: When the digital signature was signed.
element.comment: This should agree with the information in the signature.

element.short: Who signed
element.definition: A reference to an application-usable description of the identity that signed  (e.g. the signature used their private key).
element.comment: This should agree with the information in the signature.

element.short: The party represented
element.definition: A reference to an application-usable description of the identity that is represented by the signature.
element.comment: The party that can't sign. For example a child.
element.requirements: used when the signature is on behalf of a non-signer.

element.short: The technical format of the signed resources
element.definition: A mime type that indicates the technical format of the target resources signed by the signature.
element.comment: "xml", "json" and "ttl" are allowed, which describe the simple encodings described in the specification (and imply appropriate bundle support). Otherwise, mime types are legal here.

extension.valueString: The mime type of an attachment. Any valid mime type is allowed.

element.short: The technical format of the signature
element.definition: A mime type that indicates the technical format of the signature. Important mime types are application/signature+xml for X ML DigSig, application/jose for JWS, and image/* for a graphical image of a signature, etc.

extension.valueString: The mime type of an attachment. Any valid mime type is allowed.

element.short: The actual signature content (XML DigSig. JWS, picture, etc.)
element.definition: The base64 encoding of the Signature content. When signature is not recorded electronically this element would be empty.
element.comment: Where the signature type is an XML DigSig, the signed content is a FHIR Resource(s), the signature is of the XML form of the Resource(s) using  XML-Signature (XMLDIG) "Detached Signature" form.

resource.name: Statistic
resource.description: Base StructureDefinition for Statistic Type: A fact or piece of data from a  study of a large quantity of numerical data.  A mathematical or quantified characteristic of a group of observations.

element.short: Single statistic
element.definition: A fact or piece of data from a  study of a large quantity of numerical data.  A mathematical or quantified characteristic of a group of observations.

element.short: Description of content
element.definition: A description of the content value of the statistic.

element.short: Footnotes and/or explanatory notes
element.definition: Footnotes and/or explanatory notes.

element.short: Type of statistic, eg relative risk
element.definition: Type of statistic, eg relative risk.

extension.valueString: The type of a specific statistic.

element.short: Associated category for categorical variable"
element.definition: When the measured variable is handled categorically, the category element is used to define which category the statistic is reporting.
element.comment: Simple strings can be used for descriptive purposes. Exact matching to EvidenceVariable.category.name for the Evidence.variableDefinition[variableRole=measuredVariable].observed=Reference(EvidenceVariable) could facilitate validation within datasets.

element.short: Statistic value
element.definition: Statistic value.

element.short: The number of events associated with the statistic
element.definition: The number of events associated with the statistic, where the unit of analysis is different from numberAffected, sampleSize.knownDataCount and sampleSize.numberOfParticipants.
element.comment: When the number of events is the statistic, use Statistic.quantity and set Statistic.type.coding.code=C25463 and Statistic.type.coding.display=Count. When the statistic is an Event Rate (where individual participants may have 2 or more events), use Statistic.numberOfEvents to record the total number of events rather than the number of participants with events.

element.short: The number of participants affected
element.definition: The number of participants affected where the unit of analysis is the same as sampleSize.knownDataCount and sampleSize.numberOfParticipants.
element.comment: When the number affected is the statistic, use Statistic.quantity and set Statistic.type.coding.code=C25463 and Statistic.type.coding.display=Count. When the statistic is a Proportion, use Statistic.numberAffected and enter an integer as the value. When the statistic is an Event Rate (where individual participants may have 2 or more events), use Statistic.numberAffected to record the number of participants with events rather than the total number of events.

element.short: Number of samples in the statistic
element.definition: Number of samples in the statistic.

element.short: Textual description of sample size for statistic
element.definition: Human-readable summary of population sample size.

element.short: Footnote or explanatory note about the sample size
element.definition: Footnote or explanatory note about the sample size.

element.short: Number of contributing studies
element.definition: Number of participants in the population.

element.short: Cumulative number of participants
element.definition: A human-readable string to clarify or explain concepts about the sample size.

element.short: Number of participants with known results for measured variables
element.definition: Number of participants with known results for measured variables.

element.short: An attribute of the Statistic
element.definition: A statistical attribute of the statistic such as a measure of heterogeneity.

element.short: Textual description of the attribute estimate
element.definition: Human-readable summary of the estimate.

element.short: Footnote or explanatory note about the estimate
element.definition: Footnote or explanatory note about the estimate.

element.short: The type of attribute estimate, eg confidence interval or p value
element.definition: The type of attribute estimate, eg confidence interval or p value.

extension.valueString: Method of reporting variability of estimates, such as confidence intervals, interquartile range or standard deviation.

element.short: The singular quantity of the attribute estimate, for attribute estimates represented as single values; also used to report unit of measure
element.definition: The singular quantity of the attribute estimate, for attribute estimates represented as single values; also used to report unit of measure.
element.comment: Often the p value.

element.short: Level of confidence interval, eg 0.95 for 95% confidence interval
element.definition: Use 95 for a 95% confidence interval.

element.short: Lower and upper bound values of the attribute estimate
element.definition: Lower bound of confidence interval.

element.short: A nested attribute estimate; which is the attribute estimate of an attribute estimate
element.definition: A nested attribute estimate; which is the attribute estimate of an attribute estimate.
element.comment: A nested attribute estimate; which is the attribute estimate of an attribute estimate.

element.short: Textual description of the attribute estimate
element.definition: Human-readable summary of the estimate.

element.short: Footnote or explanatory note about the estimate
element.definition: Footnote or explanatory note about the estimate.

element.short: The type of attribute estimate, eg confidence interval or p value
element.definition: The type of attribute estimate, eg confidence interval or p value.

extension.valueString: Method of reporting variability of estimates, such as confidence intervals, interquartile range or standard deviation.

element.short: The singular quantity of the attribute estimate, for attribute estimates represented as single values; also used to report unit of measure
element.definition: The singular quantity of the attribute estimate, for attribute estimates represented as single values; also used to report unit of measure.
element.comment: Often the pvalue.

element.short: Level of confidence interval, eg 0.95 for 95% confidence interval
element.definition: Use 95 for a 95% confidence interval.

element.short: Lower and upper bound values of the attribute estimate
element.definition: Lower bound of confidence interval.

element.short: Model characteristic
element.definition: A component of the method to generate the statistic.

element.short: Model specification
element.definition: Description of a component of the method to generate the statistic.

element.short: Numerical value to complete model specification
element.definition: Further specification of the quantified value of the component of the method to generate the statistic.

element.short: A variable adjusted for in the adjusted analysis
element.definition: A variable adjusted for in the adjusted analysis.

element.short: Description of the variable
element.definition: Description of the variable.

element.short: continuous | dichotomous | ordinal | polychotomous
element.definition: How the variable is classified for use in adjusted analysis.

extension.valueString: The possible types of variables for exposures or outcomes (E.g. Dichotomous, Continuous, Descriptive).

element.short: Description for grouping of ordinal or polychotomous variables
element.definition: Description for grouping of ordinal or polychotomous variables.

element.short: Discrete value for grouping of ordinal or polychotomous variables
element.definition: Discrete value for grouping of ordinal or polychotomous variables.

element.short: Range of values for grouping of ordinal or polychotomous variables
element.definition: Range of values for grouping of ordinal or polychotomous variables.

resource.name: Timing
resource.description: Base StructureDefinition for Timing Type: Specifies an event that may occur multiple times. Timing schedules are used to record when things are planned, expected or requested to occur. The most common usage is in dosage instructions for medications. They are also used when planning care of various kinds, and may be used for reporting the schedule to which past regular activities were carried out.
resource.purpose: Need to able to track proposed timing schedules. There are several different ways to do this: one or more specified times, a simple rules like three times a day, or  before/after meals.

element.short: A timing schedule that specifies an event that may occur multiple times
element.definition: Specifies an event that may occur multiple times. Timing schedules are used to record when things are planned, expected or requested to occur. The most common usage is in dosage instructions for medications. They are also used when planning care of various kinds, and may be used for reporting the schedule to which past regular activities were carried out.
element.comment:
Describes the occurrence of an event that may occur multiple times. Timing schedules are used for specifying when events are expected or requested to occur, and may also be used to represent the summary of a past or ongoing event.  For simplicity, the definitions of Timing components are expressed as 'future' events, but such components can also be used to describe historic or ongoing events.

A Timing schedule can be a list of events and/or criteria for when the event happens, which can be expressed in a structured form and/or as a code. When both event and a repeating specification are provided, the list of events should be understood as an interpretation of the information in the repeat structure.

element.short: When the event occurs
element.definition: Identifies specific times when the event occurs.
element.requirements: In a Medication Administration Record, for instance, you need to take a general specification, and turn it into a precise specification.

element.short: When the event is to occur
element.definition: A set of rules that describe when the event is scheduled.
element.requirements: Many timing schedules are determined by regular repetitions.

constraint.human: If there's an offset, there must be a when (and not C, CM, CD, CV)
period SHALL be a non-negative value
If there's a periodMax, there must be a period
If there's a durationMax, there must be a duration
If there's a countMax, there must be a count
if there's a duration, there needs to be duration units
If there's a timeOfDay, there cannot be a when, or vice versa
if there's a period, there needs to be period units
duration SHALL be a non-negative value

element.short: Length/Range of lengths, or (Start and/or end) limits
element.definition: Either a duration for the length of the timing schedule, a range of possible length, or outer bounds for start and/or end limits of the timing schedule.

element.short: Number of times to repeat
element.definition: A total count of the desired number of repetitions across the duration of the entire timing specification. If countMax is present, this element indicates the lower bound of the allowed range of count values.
element.comment: If you have both bounds and count, then this should be understood as within the bounds period, until count times happens.
element.requirements: Repetitions may be limited by end time or total occurrences.

element.short: Maximum number of times to repeat
element.definition: If present, indicates that the count is a range - so to perform the action between [count] and [countMax] times.

element.short: How long when it happens
element.definition: How long this thing happens for when it happens. If durationMax is present, this element indicates the lower bound of the allowed range of the duration.
element.comment: For some events the duration is part of the definition of the event (e.g. IV infusions, where the duration is implicit in the specified quantity and rate). For others, it's part of the timing specification (e.g. exercise).
element.requirements: Some activities are not instantaneous and need to be maintained for a period of time.

element.short: How long when it happens (Max)
element.definition: If present, indicates that the duration is a range - so to perform the action between [duration] and [durationMax] time length.
element.comment: For some events the duration is part of the definition of the event (e.g. IV infusions, where the duration is implicit in the specified quantity and rate). For others, it's part of the timing specification (e.g. exercise).
element.requirements: Some activities are not instantaneous and need to be maintained for a period of time.

element.short: s | min | h | d | wk | mo | a - unit of time (UCUM)
element.definition: The units of time for the duration, in UCUM units.

extension.valueString: A unit of time (units from UCUM).

element.short: Event occurs frequency times per period
element.definition: The number of times to repeat the action within the specified period. If frequencyMax is present, this element indicates the lower bound of the allowed range of the frequency.
element.meaningWhenMissing: If no frequency is stated, the assumption is that the event occurs once per period, but systems SHOULD always be specific about this

element.short: Event occurs up to frequencyMax times per period
element.definition: If present, indicates that the frequency is a range - so to repeat between [frequency] and [frequencyMax] times within the period or period range.

element.short: Event occurs frequency times per period
element.definition: Indicates the duration of time over which repetitions are to occur; e.g. to express "3 times per day", 3 would be the frequency and "1 day" would be the period. If periodMax is present, this element indicates the lower bound of the allowed range of the period length.

element.short: Upper limit of period (3-4 hours)
element.definition: If present, indicates that the period is a range from [period] to [periodMax], allowing expressing concepts such as "do this once every 3-5 days.

element.short: s | min | h | d | wk | mo | a - unit of time (UCUM)
element.definition: The units of time for the period in UCUM units.

extension.valueString: A unit of time (units from UCUM).

element.short: mon | tue | wed | thu | fri | sat | sun
element.definition: If one or more days of week is provided, then the action happens only on the specified day(s).
element.comment: If no days are specified, the action is assumed to happen every day as otherwise specified. The elements frequency and period cannot be used as well as dayOfWeek.

element.short: Time of day for action
element.definition: Specified time of day for action to take place.
element.comment: When time of day is specified, it is inferred that the action happens every day (as filtered by dayofWeek) on the specified times. The elements when, frequency and period cannot be used as well as timeOfDay.

element.short: Code for time period of occurrence
element.definition: An approximate time period during the day, potentially linked to an event of daily living that indicates when the action should occur.
element.comment: When more than one event is listed, the event is tied to the union of the specified events.
element.requirements: Timings are frequently determined by occurrences such as waking, eating and sleep.

extension.valueString: Real world event relating to the schedule.

element.short: Minutes from event (before or after)
element.definition: The number of minutes from the event. If the event code does not indicate whether the minutes is before or after the event, then the offset is assumed to be after the event.

element.short: BID | TID | QID | AM | PM | QD | QOD | +
element.definition: A code for the timing schedule (or just text in code.text). Some codes such as BID are ubiquitous, but many institutions define their own additional codes. If a code is provided, the code is understood to be a complete statement of whatever is specified in the structured timing data, and either the code or the data may be used to interpret the Timing, with the exception that .repeat.bounds still applies over the code (and is not contained in the code).
element.comment: BID etc. are defined as 'at institutionally specified times'. For example, an institution may choose that BID is "always at 7am and 6pm".  If it is inappropriate for this choice to be made, the code BID should not be used. Instead, a distinct organization-specific code should be used in place of the HL7-defined BID code and/or a structured representation should be used (in this case, specifying the two event times).

extension.valueString: Code for a known / defined timing pattern.

resource.name: TriggerDefinition
resource.description: Base StructureDefinition for TriggerDefinition Type: A description of a triggering event. Triggering events can be named events, data events, or periodic, as determined by the type element.

element.short: Defines an expected trigger for a module
element.definition: A description of a triggering event. Triggering events can be named events, data events, or periodic, as determined by the type element.
element.comment: If an event is a named-event, it means the event is completely pre-coordinated, and no other information can be specified for the event. If the event is one of the data- events, the data and condition elements specify the triggering criteria. The data element specifies the structured component, and the condition element provides additional optional refinement of that structured component. If the event is periodic, the timing element defines when the event is triggered. For both data- and periodic events, a name can be provided as a shorthand for the formal semantics provided by the other elements.

constraint.human: A named event requires a name, a periodic event requires timing, and a data event requires data
